Class TaskQueue

A queue of tasks, which can be run in FIFO order.

Inheritance
System.Object
TaskQueue
Implements

Syntax
public sealed class TaskQueue : IDisposable

Methods

| Improve this Doc View Source

Clear(Action<Exception>)

Removes all pending tasks from the queue. Also calls System.IDisposable.Dispose() on tasks which implement the method.

Declaration
public void Clear(Action<Exception> exceptionHandler = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Action<System.Exception> exceptionHandler

Method for handling an exception thrown by a task's System.IDisposable.Dispose().
Remarks

As the method iterates through all tasks in the queue and calls System.IDisposable.Dispose() on tasks, it can hang for an unknown amount of time. If an exception is thrown in an System.IDisposable.Dispose() call, the method continues on with disposing the remaining tasks.

| Improve this Doc View Source

Dispose()

Disposes all tasks which implements System.IDisposable.

Declaration
public void Dispose()
Remarks

As the method iterates through all tasks in the queue and calls System.IDisposable.Dispose() on tasks, it can hang for an unknown amount of time. If an exception is thrown in an System.IDisposable.Dispose() call, the method continues on with disposing the remaining tasks.

| Improve this Doc View Source

Finalize()

Finalizes an instance of the TaskQueue class. Also disposes of tasks implementing System.IDisposable.Dispose().

Declaration
protected void Finalize()
| Improve this Doc View Source

TryRunNextTask()

Try to run the next task in the queue, if present.

Declaration
public bool TryRunNextTask()
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if a task was run, false if the TaskQueue is empty.
Remarks

Please note that the return value does not indicate if a task was successful. The method will return true if a task was ready in the queue, regardless if an exception occured.

| Improve this Doc View Source

TryRunNextTask(IProfiler)

Try to run the next task in the queue, if present. Also performs profiling on the task through an IProfiler.

Declaration
public bool TryRunNextTask(IProfiler profiler)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IProfiler profiler

IProfiler to profile the run-time of the task.
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if a task was run, false if the TaskQueue is empty.
Remarks

Please note that the return value does not indicate if a task was successful. The method will return true if a task was ready in the queue, regardless if an exception occured.

| Improve this Doc View Source

TryRunNextTask(IProfiler, out Exception)

Try to run the next task in the queue, if present. Also performs profiling on the task through an IProfiler, and provides an System.Exception thrown by the task in case it fails.

Declaration
public bool TryRunNextTask(IProfiler profiler, out Exception exception)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IProfiler profiler

IProfiler to profile the run-time of the task.
System.Exception exception

System.Exception thrown if task failed. Is null if task was run successfully.
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if a task was run, false if the TaskQueue is empty.
Remarks

Please note that the return value does not indicate if a task was successful. The method will return true if a task was ready in the queue, regardless if an exception occured.

| Improve this Doc View Source

TryRunNextTask(out Exception)

Try to run the next task in the queue, if present. Also provides an System.Exception thrown by the task in case it fails.

Declaration
public bool TryRunNextTask(out Exception exception)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Exception exception

System.Exception thrown if task failed. Is null if task was run successfully.
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if a task was run, false if the TaskQueue is empty.
Remarks

Please note that the return value does not indicate if a task was successful. The method will return true if a task was ready in the queue, regardless if an exception occured.
